text: so each year there are nearly a hundred
thousand deaths as a result of
hospital-acquired infections a large
number of these infections are caused by
biofilm forming bacteria such as
Staphylococcus and pseudomonas these
bacteria form biofilms on a variety of
hospitalized equipment instrumentation
and other surfaces and are particularly
difficult to eradicate in the China with
lab we're looking at understanding and
studying the bacterial signaling
pathways that control biofilm formation
to that end we use a variety of
different synthetic organic techniques
and enzymatic techniques to synthesize
analogs for antimicrobial purposes
behind me is an automated chromatography
system as an undergrad I'm not always
allowed to use this machine but when I
do it severely increases my efficiency
and workflow compound our reaction
mixtures can be loaded on a variety of
pre-prepared columns and run on normal
phase and reverse phase using a variety
of different methods the detector or it
has a UV detector as well as a light
scattering detector to detect molecules
and aren't you the active I'm a my name
is Abraham Waldman I'm an undergraduate
studying chemistry and biochemistry in
the chenoweth lab at the University of
Pennsylvania
